locality: South Africa. Eastern Cape., Farm Shalom 2 km south of Willowmore on N9. On south feeing slopes amongst bushes.: 33° 19' 40 S: 23° 28' 741 E Jentle southern hill slope in full sun on grazed land. In well-drained stony soil f quartzite gravel. Common where found. Succulent Karoo. Perennial sprawling succulent 5-20 cm across. Stem central, woody and grooved with dead leaves at base forming a white net. Leaves very soft and water-filled, light green, depressed and flat with pointed tip, 25x15mm. Terminal, solitary flowers pale yellow and feathery petals, 40 mm in diameter, subtended by 2 bracts.. (Local Name: Kougoed - Language: Afrikaans)
